intro: Draba caroliniana, commonly known as Carolina rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Draba caroliniana is an important component of early successional plant communities and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
